title: Spaghetti Carbonara
summary: A classic Italian pasta dish with eggs, cheese, bacon, and black pepper.
instructions: Bring a large pot of salted water to boil and cook spaghetti according to package directions until al dente.
While pasta cooks, cut pancetta into small cubes and cook in a large skillet over medium heat until crispy, about 5-7 minutes.
In a bowl, whisk together eggs and grated Pecorino Romano cheese. Season with black pepper.
Reserve 1 cup of pasta cooking water before draining.
Add drained hot pasta to the skillet with pancetta and toss to combine.
Remove from heat and quickly stir in the egg mixture, adding pasta water gradually until creamy.
Serve immediately with extra cheese and black pepper.

title: Chicken Tikka Masala
summary: Chunks of grilled chicken (tikka) cooked in a smooth buttery & creamy tomato based gravy.
ingredients: 800g boneless chicken thighs, cut into chunks
instructions: In a bowl, mix yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, garam masala, turmeric, cumin, and chili powder. Add chicken and marinate for at least 2 hours.
Preheat grill or oven to high heat. Thread chicken onto skewers and grill until charred and cooked through, about 15-20 minutes.
In a large pan, heat butter and sauté onions until golden brown.
Add tomato puree and cook until the mixture thickens and oil separates.
Stir in heavy cream and simmer for 5 minutes.
Add grilled chicken pieces to the sauce and simmer for another 10 minutes.
Garnish with fresh cilantro and serve with rice or naan.

title: Beef Wellington
summary: A classic dish of beef tenderloin coated with mushroom duxelles and wrapped in puff pastry.
instructions: Season beef tenderloin with salt and pepper. Heat oil in a pan and sear beef on all sides until browned. Brush with mustard and let cool.
In the same pan, cook mushrooms, shallots, and garlic until all moisture evaporates. This is your duxelles.
Lay out prosciutto slices overlapping on plastic wrap. Spread duxelles evenly over prosciutto.
Place seared beef on top of duxelles and roll tightly using plastic wrap. Chill for 30 minutes.
Roll out puff pastry and place beef roll in center. Wrap pastry around beef, sealing edges with egg wash.
Brush entire pastry with egg wash and score decorative patterns on top.
Bake at 200°C for 40-45 minutes until pastry is golden and beef reaches 55°C internal temperature.
Rest for 10 minutes before slicing and serving.

title: Caesar Salad
summary: Fresh romaine lettuce with Caesar dressing, croutons, and parmesan cheese.
instructions: Wash and dry romaine lettuce thoroughly. Tear into bite-sized pieces.
In a blender, combine anchovies, garlic, egg yolks, mustard, lemon juice, salt, and pepper.
Slowly drizzle in olive oil while blending to create a smooth emulsion.
Toss lettuce with dressing until well coated.
Add croutons and grated Parmesan cheese.
Toss gently to combine and serve immediately.

title: Chocolate Soufflé
summary: A light and airy French dessert made with chocolate, eggs, and sugar.
instructions: Preheat oven to 190°C. Butter ramekins and dust with sugar.
Melt chocolate and butter together in a double boiler until smooth.
Whisk egg yolks with half the sugar until pale and thick.
Stir melted chocolate into egg yolk mixture.
In a clean bowl, beat egg whites with salt until foamy.
Gradually add remaining sugar and beat until stiff peaks form.
Gently fold egg whites into chocolate mixture in thirds.
Fill ramekins 3/4 full and bake for 18-20 minutes until risen and set on outside but soft in center.
Dust with powdered sugar and serve immediately.

title: Margherita Pizza
summary: Simple yet delicious pizza with tomato sauce, fresh mozzarella, and basil leaves.
instructions: Preheat oven to 250°C with pizza stone if available.
Roll out pizza dough on floured surface to 12-inch circle.
Mix tomato sauce with minced garlic, salt, and pepper.
Spread sauce evenly over dough, leaving 1-inch border.
Arrange mozzarella slices on top of sauce.
Drizzle with olive oil and season with salt and pepper.
Bake for 10-12 minutes until crust is golden and cheese is bubbly.
Remove from oven and immediately top with fresh basil leaves.
Let cool slightly before slicing and serving.
